text: The dioceses of Scotland in the High and Later Middle Ages were: {| class="wikitable" |- align=left ! width="35%"|Diocese ! width="35%"|Cathedral ! width="30%"|Notes |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |Aberdeen||Old Aberdeen|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |Argyll||Lismore||it was suggested moving the cathedral to Saddell Abbey, but this did not transpire |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |Brechin||Brechin|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |Caithness||Dornoch|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |Dunblane ||Dunblane|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |Dunkeld||Dunkeld|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |Galloway||Whithorn||cathedral originally at Skeabost |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |Glasgow||Glasgow|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |Moray||Elgin||prior to settling at Elgin, cathedrals were at Birnie, Spynie and at Kinneddar |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |Orkney||Kirkwall||cathedral originally at Birsay |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |Ross||Fortrose||cathedral originally at Rosemarkie |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |St Andrews||St Andrews|| |- valign=top bgcolor="#ffffec" |The Isles||Iona||diocese founded at St Germans Cathedral, Peel |} ==See also== List of cathedrals in the United Kingdom Category:Scotland in the High Middle Ages Category:Subdivisions of Scotland Category:Scotland in the Late Middle Ages
title: Dioceses of Scotland in the High and Later Middle Ages
